str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A Laodicean, an inhabitant of Laodicea. From Laodikeia; a Laodicean, i.e. Inhabitant of Laodicia.
And, even, also, namely.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From a compound of laos and dike; Laodicia, a place in Asia Minor.
